message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.DS, cs.FL, cs.SE 

The paper deals with the problem of conditional termination, which is a topic in the area of program analysis and verification. The paper presents a method for computing weakest non-termination preconditions for loops with certain types of transition relations, such as octagonal and finite monoid affine relations. These types of relations are commonly studied in the areas of logic and algebra, which suggests that the paper may be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) and cs.PL (Programming Languages). The paper also discusses the use of Kleene sequences and well-founded relations, which are concepts from the areas of automata theory and graph theory, respectively, indicating that the paper may be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory). Finally, the paper presents algorithms for computing transition invariants and termination preconditions, which are topics in the area of software engineering, suggesting that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.SE (Software Engineering).
